intro: Gymnadenia habenarioides, commonly known as the slender grass pinks, is a perennial herbaceous plant belonging to the Orchidaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, pinkish-purple flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and wetlands. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, and it has a rhizomatous root system that helps it spread and establish in suitable environments. Gymnadenia habenarioides is often found in temperate regions and is of interest to botanists due to its ecological and ornamental value.
